content: Given the following mathematical function expressions, you need to calculate the indefinite integral of the function (excluding the constant C), then substitute 'x=4' into the result of the indefinite integral, and finally provide me with the integer result of the expression by rounding down. (The answer should consist of only a single integer number representing the final result, with no additional words.)

" First, let's calculate the indefinite integral of the function.

The indefinite integral of e^x/ln(x) is:

∫e^x/ln(x) dx = e^x ln(e) - ∫e^x ln(x) dx

Now we will calculate the second integral.

∫e^x ln(x) dx = e^x ln(x^2/2) - ∫e^x (2ln(x) - 1) dx

Now we will calculate the second integral.

∫e^x (2ln(x) - 1) dx = e^x (2xln(x) - x) - ∫e^x (2xln(x) - x - 1) dx

Now we will calculate the third integral.

∫e^x (2xln(x) - x - 1) dx = e^x (x^2ln(x) - x^2/2 - x/2 + 1/2) - ∫e^x (x^2ln(x) - x^2/2 - x/2 + 1/2 - 1) dx

Now we will calculate the fourth integral.

∫e^x (x^2ln(x) - x^2/2 - x/2 + 1/2 - 1) dx = e^x (1/2 - ln(x) - 1/2x^2 - 1/4x^2 + 1/4x) - ∫e^x (1/2 - ln(x) - 1/2x^2 - 1/4x^2 + 1/4x - 1/2) dx

Now we will calculate the fifth integral.

∫e^x (1/2 - ln(x) - 1/2x^2 - 1/4x^2 + 1/4x - 1/2) dx = e^x (1/4x^2 - 1/2x^2ln(x) - 1/4x^3 + 1/8x^3 - 1/8x^2 + 1/8x) - ∫e^x (1/4x^2 - 1/2x^2ln(x) - 1/4x^3 + 1/8x^3 - 1/8x^2 + 1/8x - 1/2) dx

Now we will calculate the sixth integral.

∫e^x (1/4x^2 - 1/2x^2ln(x) - 1/4x^3 + 1/8x^3 - 1/8x^2 + 1/8x - 1/2) dx = e^x (1/8x^3 - 1/4x^3ln(x) - 1/4x^4 + 1/16x^4 - 1/16x^3 + 1/16x^2 - 1/16x) - ∫e^x (1/8x^3 - 1/4x^3ln(x) - 1/4x^4 + 1/16x^4 - 1/16x^3 + 1/16x^2 - 1/16x - 1/2) dx

Now we will calculate the seventh integral.

∫e^x (1/8x^3 - 1/4x^3ln(x) - 1/4x^4 + 1/16x^4 - 1/16x^3 + 1/16x^2 - 1/16x - 1/2) dx = e^x (1/16x^4 - 1/8x^4ln(x) - 1/4x^5 + 1/32x^5 - 1/32x^4 + 1/32x^3 - 1/32x^2 + 1/32x - 1/32) - ∫e^x (1/16x^4 - 1/8x^4ln(x) - 1/4x^5 + 1/32x^5 - 1/32x^4 + 1/32x^3 - 1/32x^2 + 1/32x - 1"

" First, let's calculate the indefinite integral of the function.

The indefinite integral of 5*(e^x/ln(x)) is:

∫5*(e^x/ln(x)) dx = 5*(e^x ln(e) - ∫5*(e^x ln(x) dx)

Now we will calculate the second integral.

∫5*(e^x ln(x) dx) = 5*(e^x ln(x^2) - ∫5*(e^x (2ln(x) - 1) dx)

Now we will calculate the third integral.

∫5*(e^x (2ln(x) - 1) dx) = 5*(e^x (2xln(x) - x) - ∫5*(e^x (2xln(x) - x - 1) dx)

Now we will calculate the fourth integral.

∫5*(e^x (2xln(x) - x - 1) dx) = 5*(e^x (x^2ln(x) - x^2/2 - x/2 + 1/2) - ∫5*(e^x (x^2ln(x) - x^2/2 - x/2 + 1/2 - 1) dx)

Now we will calculate the fifth integral.

∫5*(e^x (x^2ln(x) - x^2/2 - x/2 + 1/2 - 1) dx) = 5*(e^x (1/2 - ln(x) - 1/2x^2 - 1/4x^2 + 1/4x - 1/4) - ∫5*(e^x (1/2 - ln(x) - 1/2x^2 - 1/4x^2 + 1/4x - 1/2) dx)

Now we will calculate the sixth integral.

∫5*(e^x (1/2 - ln(x) - 1/2x^2 - 1/4x^2 + 1/4x - 1/4) dx) = 5*(e^x (1/4x^2 - 1/2x^2ln(x) - 1/4x^4 + 1/16x^4 - 1/16x^3 + 1/16x^2 - 1/16x) - ∫5*(e^x (1/4x^2 - 1/2x^2ln(x) - 1/4x^4 + 1/16x^4 - 1/16x^3 + 1/16x^2 - 1/16x - 1/8) dx)

Now we will calculate the seventh integral.

∫5*(e^x (1/4x^2 - 1/2x^2ln(x) - 1/4x^4 + 1/16x^4 - 1/16x^3 + 1/16x^2 - 1/16x - 1/8) dx) = 5*(e^x (1/16x^4 - 1/8x^4ln(x) - 1/4x^5 + 1/32x^5 - 1/32x^4 + 1/32x^3 - 1/32x^2 + 1/32x - 1/32) - ∫5*(e^x (1/16x^4 - 1/8x^4ln(x) - 1/4x^5 + 1/32x^5 - 1/32x^4 + 1/32x^3 - 1/32x^2 + 1/32x - 1/4) dx)

Now we will calculate the eighth integral.

∫5*(e^x (1/16x^4 - 1/8x^4ln(x) - 1/4x^5 + 1/32x^5 - 1/32x^4 + 1/32x^3 - 1/32x^2 + 1/32x - 1/"
